title: Real GDP of New York , by industry 2018
yAxis: Real value added in billion chained (2012) U.S. dollars
summary: This bar chart has 14 categories for the x axis representing Industry, and a y axis representing Real value added in billion chained (2012) U.S. dollars.
The highest category is found at Finance_insurance_real_estate_rental_and_leasing where Real value added in billion chained (2012) U.S. dollars is 418.87.
The lowest category is found at Mining_quarrying_and_oil_and_gas_extraction where Real value added in billion chained (2012) U.S. dollars is 1.2.

data.Industry: Finance insurance real estate rental and leasing
Educational services health care and social assistance
Arts entertainment recreation accommodation and food services
Mining quarrying and oil and gas extraction

gold: This graph shows the real value added to the Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of New York in 2018 , by industry . In 2018 , the mining industry added 1.2 billion chained 2012 U.S. dollars of value to the state GDP . Total real GDP amounted to about 1.44 trillion chained 2012 U.S. dollars .
